%text Let $A$ run twice as fast as $B$ and $B$ run 3 times as fast as $C$. Then how fast does $A$ run compared to $C$?
The answer is simple -- $(2\times 3 = 6)$
That was the Chain Rule. And it works just the same way with functions.
\textbf{Chain Rule} Let $f(x)$ be a composite function.
\[ \quad f(x) = g\left[ h(x) \right] = (g\circ h)(x) \]
In other words, $f(x)$ is made by \underline\text{applying $g(x)$ on $h(x)$}. Then,
\[\qquad \frac{d}{dx}f(x) = \frac{dg}{dh}\times\dfrac{dh}{dx} \]
